FuncDef:
The trunkport command adds interfaces to an IP-Trunk interface in batches in the IP-Trunk interface view.
The undo trunkport command deletes member interfaces from an IP-Trunk interface in batches in the IP-Trunk interface view.
By default, no member interface is added to the IP-Trunk.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of interfaces to be added to an IP-Trunk interface, for example, POS.
-

Specifies the number of the interface to be added to an IP-Trunk interface. to is placed between two interfaces, indicating that all interfaces from <beginifnum> to <endifnnum> are added to the IP-Trunk interface.
-

Specifies the number of the interface to be added to an IP-Trunk interface. to is placed between two interfaces, indicating that all interfaces from <beginifnum> to <endifnnum> are added to the IP-Trunk interface.
-

Specifies the name of the interface to be added to an IP-Trunk interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Trunk is a technology that bundles multiple physical interfaces into a logical interface. The logical interface is a trunk interface and the bundled physical interfaces are member interfaces. To add physical interfaces to an IP-Trunk interface in batches to increase the bandwidth, improve the reliability, and perform load balancing, run the trunkport command.
To add only one interface to an IP-Trunk interface, you can run the trunkport command.
To delete member interfaces from an IP-Trunk interface in batches, you can run the undo trunkport command in the view of the specified IP-Trunk interface.
To delete only one member interface from an IP-Trunk interface, you can run the undo trunkport command in the view of the specified IP-Trunk interface. Alternatively, you can run the undo ip-trunk command in the view of the specified member interface.
Prerequisites
Member interfaces to be added to an IP-Trunk interface cannot be configured with Layer 3 attributes or any service.The link layer protocol of the interface to be added to an IP-Trunk interface must be HDLC and cannot be changed.

Precautions
When adding interfaces to an IP-Trunk interface, note the following:
The link layer protocol of the interfaces to be added to the IP-Trunk interface must be HDLC.A POS interface can be added to only one IP-Trunk interface. The POS interface must be deleted from one IP-Trunk interface before joining another IP-Trunk interface.The interfaces to be added to the IP-Trunk interface cannot be IP-Trunk interfaces.POS interfaces with different forwarding capacities are not recommended to join the same IP-Trunk interface.If the interface connecting to the peer device is added to an IP-Trunk interface, the directly connected interface on the peer device must also be added to the same IP-Trunk interface.When you specify the interface range, make ensure that the interface range is specified in the correct format: The interface number after to must be greater than the interface number before to. Interfaces in the specified range must be of the same type.
